item.title: Scroll snapping with CSS!
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: CSS scroll snapping allows for controlled scrolling experiences. If a user scrolls partially down/across an element, the CSS can force the scroll to snap to the top of the element instead.. or something. I haven’t given this a go, because I only just found out ğŸ¤¯ Browser compatibility Fully-fledged in ğŸ Safari and ğŸ¤– Chrome support this feature in it latest builds. ğŸ¦Š Firefox supports properties from an older specification.
